  16. (* A few extensions to OCaml's standard library *)

  18. module Unix = Ocamltest_unix

  20. ‌let input_line_opt ic =
  21.   try Some (input_line ic) with End_of_file -> None

  23. module Char = struct
  24.   include Char
  25. ‌  let is_blank c =
  26.     c = ' ' || c = '\012' || c = '\n' || c = '\r' || c =  '\t'
  27. end

  29. module Filename = struct
  30.   include Filename
  31. ‌  let path_sep = if Sys.win32 then ";" else ":"
  32.   (* This function comes from otherlibs/unix/unix_win32.ml *)
  33. ‌  let maybe_quote f =
  34.     if f = ""
  35.     || String.exists (function ' ' | '\"' | '\t' -> true | _ -> false) f
  36.     then Filename.quote f
  37.     else f

  39.   let make_filename name ext = String.concat "." [name; ext]

  41.   let make_path components = List.fold_left Filename.concat "" components

  43.   let mkexe filename = filename ^ Ocamltest_config.exe
  44. end

  46. module List = struct
  47.   include List
  48.   let rec concatmap f = function
  49.     | [] -> []
  50.     | x::xs -> (f x) @ (concatmap f xs)
  51. end

  53. module String = struct
  54.   include Misc.Stdlib.String
  55. ‌  let string_of_char = String.make 1

  57. ‌  let words s =
  58.     let l = String.length s in
  59.     let rec f quote w ws i =
  60.       if i>=l then begin
  61.         if w<>"" then List.rev (w::ws)
  62.         else List.rev ws
  63.       end else begin
  64. ‌        let j = i+1 in
  65.         match s.[i] with
  66.           | '\''
  67.           | '"' as c ->
  68.             begin
  69.               match quote with
  70.               | None ->
  71.                 (* Begin quoted word *)
  72.                 f (Some c) w ws j
  73.               | Some quote_char when quote_char = c ->
  74.                 (* End quoted word *)
  75.                 f None w ws j
  76.               | _ ->
  77.                 (* Continue string *)
  78.                 f quote (w ^ (string_of_char c)) ws j
  79.             end
  80.           | ' ' ->
  81.             begin
  82.               if quote <> None
  83.               then f quote (w ^ (string_of_char ' ')) ws j
  84.               else begin
  85.                 if w=""
  86.                 then f None w ws j
  87.                 else f None "" (w::ws) j
  88.               end
  89.             end
  90.           | _ as c -> f quote (w ^ (string_of_char c)) ws j
  91.       end in
  92.     if l=0 then [] else f None "" [] 0
  93. end

  95. module Sys = struct
  96.   include Sys

  98. ‌  let erase_file path =
  99.     try Sys.remove path
  100.     with Sys_error _ when Sys.win32 && Ocamltest_config.libunix <> None ->
  101.       (* Deal with read-only attribute on Windows. Ignore any error from chmod
  102.          so that the message always come from Sys.remove *)
  103.       let () = try Unix.chmod path 0o666 with Sys_error _ -> () in
  104.       Sys.remove path

  106. ‌  let rm_rf path =
  107.     let rec erase path =
  108.       (* Sys.file_exists will return false for dangling symlinks *)
  109.       if Sys.file_exists path then
  110.         if Sys.is_directory path then begin
  111.           (* path might be a symlink to a directory *)
  112.           try Sys.remove path
  113.           with Sys_error _ ->
  114.             (* path is definitely a directory, not a symlink to a directory *)
  115.             Array.iter (fun entry -> erase (Filename.concat path entry))
  116.                        (Sys.readdir path);
  117.             Sys.rmdir path
  118.         end else erase_file path
  119.       else erase_file path
  120.     in
  121.       if Sys.file_exists path then
  122.         try erase path
  123.         with Sys_error err ->
  124.           raise (Sys_error (Printf.sprintf "Failed to remove %S (%s)" path err))
  125.       else
  126.         (* path could be a dangling symlink *)
  127.         try Sys.remove path
  128.         with Sys_error _ -> ()

  130. ‌  let rec make_directory dir =
  131.     if Sys.file_exists dir then ()
  132.     else let () = make_directory (Filename.dirname dir) in
  133.          if not (Sys.file_exists dir) then
  134.            Sys.mkdir dir 0o777
  135.          else ()

  137. ‌  let make_directory dir =
  138.     try make_directory dir
  139.     with Sys_error err ->
  140.       raise (Sys_error (Printf.sprintf "Failed to create %S (%s)" dir err))

  142. ‌  let with_input_file ?(bin=false) x f =
  143.     let ic = (if bin then open_in_bin else open_in) x in
  144.     Fun.protect ~finally:(fun () -> close_in_noerr ic)
  145.       (fun () -> f ic)

  147.   let file_is_empty filename =
  148.     not (Sys.file_exists filename) ||
  149.     with_input_file filename in_channel_length = 0

  151.   let string_of_file filename =
  152.     with_input_file ~bin:true filename @@ fun chan ->
  153.     let filesize = in_channel_length chan in
  154.     if filesize > Sys.max_string_length then
  155.       failwith
  156.         ("The file " ^ filename ^ " is too large to be loaded into a string")
  157.     else begin
  158.       try really_input_string chan filesize
  159.       with End_of_file ->
  160.         failwith ("Got unexpected end of file while reading " ^ filename)
  161.     end

  163.   let iter_lines_of_file f filename =
  164.     let rec go ic =
  165.       match input_line ic with
  166.       | exception End_of_file -> ()
  167.       | l -> f l; go ic
  168.     in
  169.     with_input_file filename go

  171. ‌  let dump_file oc ?(prefix = "") filename =
  172.     let f s =
  173.       output_string oc prefix; output_string oc s; output_char oc '\n' in
  174.     iter_lines_of_file f filename

  176. ‌  let with_output_file ?(bin=false) x f =
  177.     let oc = (if bin then open_out_bin else open_out) x in
  178.     Fun.protect ~finally:(fun () -> close_out_noerr oc)
  179.       (fun () -> f oc)

  181.   let copy_chan ic oc =
  182.     let m = in_channel_length ic in
  183. ‌    let m = (m lsr 12) lsl 12 in
  184. ‌    let m = Int.max 16384 (Int.min Sys.max_string_length m) in
  185. ‌    let buf = Bytes.create m in
  186. ‌    let rec loop () =
  187.       let len = input ic buf 0 m in
  188.       if len > 0 then begin
  189.         output oc buf 0 len;
  190.         loop ()
  191.       end
  192.     in loop ()

  194. ‌  let copy_file src dest =
  195.     with_input_file ~bin:true src @@ fun ic ->
  196.     with_output_file ~bin:true dest @@ fun oc ->
  197.     copy_chan ic oc

  199. ‌  let rec copy_directory src dst =
  200.     let full_src_path name = Filename.concat src name in
  201.     let full_dst_path name = Filename.concat dst name in
  202.     make_directory dst;
  203.     let content = Array.to_list (readdir src) in
  204.     let is_directory d = is_directory (full_src_path d) in
  205.     let (subdirs, files) = List.partition is_directory content in
  206.     let cp_file name = copy_file (full_src_path name) (full_dst_path name) in
  207.     List.iter cp_file files;
  208.     let cp_dir name =
  209.       copy_directory (full_src_path name) (full_dst_path name)
  210.     in
  211.     List.iter cp_dir subdirs

  213. ‌  let force_remove file =
  214.     if file_exists file then remove file

  216. ‌  let with_chdir path f =
  217.     let oldcwd = Sys.getcwd () in
  218.     Sys.chdir path;
  219.     Fun.protect ~finally:(fun () -> Sys.chdir oldcwd) f

  221.   let getenv_with_default_value variable default_value =
  222.     try Sys.getenv variable with Not_found -> default_value
  223. ‌  let safe_getenv variable = getenv_with_default_value variable ""
  224. end

  226. module Seq = struct
  227.   include Seq

  229. ‌  let rec equal s1 s2 =
  230.     match s1 (), s2 () with
  231.     | Nil, Nil -> true
  232.     | Cons(e1, s1), Cons(e2, s2) -> e1 = e2 && equal s1 s2
  233.     | _, _ -> false
  234. end
